intro: Tragacantha severzovii, commonly known as the Severzov's tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by pod-like fruits containing seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
